title: PERIBOIA
content:
PERIBOIA (Periboea) was a Naiad-nymph of the city of Sparta in Lakedaimonia (Lacedaemonia) (southern Greece).
        She was the mother by the Spartan prince Ikarios (Icarius) of Odysseus' wife Penelope and several sons.

THOAS, DMASIPPOS, IMEUSIMOS, ALETES, PERILEOS, PENELOPE (by Ikarios) (Apollodorus
          3.126)

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 3. 126 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd
          A.D.) :
        "To Ikarios (Icarius) and a Naias Nymphe named Periboia (Periboea) were born Thoas, Dmasippos (Dmasippus),
        Imeusimos (Imeusimus), Aletes, Perileos (Perileus), and a daughter Penelope, whom Odysseus married."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
